Name: Escape Alcatraz
Description:
Two 45 minute escape adventures await you in our holiday box!   Our agency is in crisis!  The Clockmaker, head of EMIT, has been framed and locked up in the world famous prison known as Alcatraz.  The place is said to be the most secure prison on Earth, with many escape attempts proving to be failures.  That is where you come in…  You have 2 missions to complete.  First, find a way to escape your jail cell before the guards notice you are missing.  Clues are hidden everywhere, along with the tools you will need to get out.  The second mission asks you to do the impossible:  Rescue the boss and find a way to escape the island itself.  The search light is always watching for you and the bay is known to hold Great White sharks… yet this escape attempt is your only option to save our agency and perhaps the entire world.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Name: Escape the Mothman
Description:
In this eerie, yet family friendly, escape adventure, we are sending you back in time to the quiet town of Point Pleasant, West Virginia.  At first glance, it seems like the least likely place in the world for something sinister to happen.  However, in 1966-1967 the small town was rocked by the appearance of a mysterious creature…one known as the Mothman.  With large wings, glowing red eyes, and the aura of danger hovering around it, the creature roamed the woods and the skies.  We are sending you back to 1967 to investigate claims of a Mothman sighting where your name was brought up by the creature.  An abandoned cabin holds the secrets you need, where the radio crackles with incomprehensible codes and strange men in black suits stalk the streets waiting for your arrival.  You only have an hour to explore the cabin, piece together the evidence, and escape before you end up disappearing into the night.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Name: Escape: Quest for the Lost City
Description:
This is no ordinary treasure hunt.  This is not the city of gold… this is something much bigger than that.  The Incan Empire was one of the most mysterious civilizations the world has ever known and it holds one of the largest secrets.  The lost city of Patiti was said to be a massive city filled with gold, jewels, and priceless treasures.  Tucked away in the lush jungles of Peru, the city has claimed the lives of many explorers who have tried to find the path, but they never held the secret you do.  A mysterious package has been delivered to us from the Vatican filled with maps and tools used by Spanish conquistadors.  It appears the lost city had been found before… and with the maps in your possession, you have the chance to find it again.  In this combination treasure hunt and escape room, you must unravel the path, decode the secrets, and survive the quest, with danger lurking only steps behind.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Name: Escape the World's Fair Killer
Description:
Two 45 Minute Escape Adventures await in this box!  Your mission takes you back to the 1893 World’s Fair in Chicago, where you will have a choice to make.  One Escape Adventure is a Family Friendly exploration through the fair which introduced the Ferris Wheel, Cracker Jacks, and many other iconic inventions as you search out a misplaced object in time.  Will you be able to discover all of the secrets of the World’s Fair?  The other Escape Adventure, however, takes a darker turn.  HH Holmes, America’s first Serial Killer, set up a hotel near the World’s Fair and rigged its rooms with a variety of traps to ensnare his victims.  Step into his hotel and dare to avoid the traps and escape in time.  Will you escape or become his next victim?   Both games are included in this next adventure to play separately or together!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Name: Escape: Secret Agent
Description:
It is time for a covert operation, agents.  Our arch-rival, Mr. X, is said to be building a sort of a time bomb back in the late 1960’s.  Our intel is that the plans for this bomb, as well as how to disarm it, can be found buried in the files in a skyscraper run by Mr. X.  We need you to infiltrate the tower, avoiding security, and to make your way to the very top.  Uncover everything you can about his dastardly plans and escape the tower before you can be compromised.  Then, use what you discovered to determine the location of the attack.  It will be up to you to find and disarm the bomb before it detonates.  If we do not stop Mr. X’s plans, the consequences could be disastrous.  In this family-friendly spy adventure, you have two games to complete in the box, facing twists and turns… traitors and cliffhangers…  Work your way higher and higher up the tower to discover all of the plans in time.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Name: Sheboygan-opoly
Description:
Monopoly with a unique Sheboygan twist.  Don't eat too many onion rings at the Charcoal Inn!

Each game is a walk around a specific town and the board spaces are the buildings, local businesses and traditions that are special to that town.

Follows traditional Monopoly rules.

Name: Smart10: Neue Fragen 3.0
Description:
200 new questions, 2,000 new answers - the expansion "New Questions 3.0" brings further challenges for quiz fans with additional questions on different topics.

For all Smartboxes of the Smart 10 series, there is even more variety with the "New Questions 3.0" extension. The sequel for exciting quiz evenings has 200 new questions and thus 2,000 possible answers. As in the original game, the topics here are wide-ranging and can make the two to eight players, ages 14 and up, ponder: Which US Presidents died in office: Kennedy, Roosevelt and/or perhaps Eisenhower? What are the first names of the rock guitarists from Led Zeppelin or Police and in which country were Formula 1 world champions like Vettel or Lauda born?

There are ten answer options to choose from for each question, which are covered with markers. Whoever has a turn chooses one of them, checks whether it is correct and passes the smart box on to the next player. If you don't want to give an answer anymore, it's better to pass, because if you get it wrong, you lose all the points you have collected in the current round. Who knows the right answers or guesses and gambles best?

The pack contains 100 double-sided expansion cards with new questions and can also be mixed with the cards from the original game.

Only playable with the Smartbox from the original game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

200 neue Fragen, 2.000 neue Antworten – die Erweiterung „Neue Fragen 3.0“ bringt mit Zusatzfragen zu unterschiedlichen Themengebieten weitere Herausforderungen für Quizfans.

Für alle Smartboxen der Smart 10-Reihe gibt es noch mehr Abwechslung durch die Erweiterung „Neue Fragen 3.0“. Die Fortsetzung für spannende Quizabende hält 200 neue Fragen und damit 2.000 Antwortmöglichkeiten bereit. Wie im Originalspiel sind die Themen hier breit gefächert und können die zwei bis acht Spieler ab 14 Jahren ganz schön ins Grübeln kommen lassen: Welche US-Präsidenten sind im Amt verstorben: Kennedy, Roosevelt und/oder vielleicht Eisenhower? Wie heißen die Rock-Gitarristen von Led Zeppelin oder Police mit Vornamen und in welchem Land wurden Formel 1-Weltmeister wie Vettel oder Lauda geboren?

Pro Frage stehen zehn Antwortmöglichkeiten zur Wahl, die mit Markern abgedeckt sind. Wer an der Reihe ist, wählt eine davon aus, kontrolliert, ob’s stimmt und gibt die Smartbox an den nächsten Spieler weiter. Wer keine Antwort mehr geben will, sollte besser passen, denn wer falsch liegt, verliert alle Punkte, die er in der laufenden Runde gesammelt hat. Wer weiß die richtigen Antworten oder rät und zockt am besten?

Die Packung beinhaltet 100 beidseitig bedruckte Zusatzkarten mit neuen Fragen und kann auch mit den Karten aus dem Originalspiel gemischt werden.

Nur spielbar mit der Smartbox aus dem Originalspiel!

—description from the publisher

Name: Smart10: History
Description:
100 new questions, 1,000 new answers from the History section!

The “History” theme edition is ideal for anyone who is familiar with history. Simply exchange the 100 new questions with half the deck of cards from the Smartbox of the original game or the Family Edition and nothing stands in the way of further exciting quiz rounds.

Questions such as "Which Greek deity is responsible for sleep?", which countries were members of the Warsaw Pact or whether the 100-year war ended in the 15th or 16th century are sure to make history professionals from the age of 14 ponder or encourage gambling.

There are ten answer options to choose from for each question, which are covered with markers. Whoever has a turn chooses one of them, checks whether it is correct and passes the smart box on to the next player. If you don't want to give an answer anymore, it's better to pass, because if you get it wrong, you lose all the points you have collected in the current round. Who knows the right answers or guesses and gambles best?

The pack contains 50 double-sided cards with new questions and answers for even more fun.

Only playable with the Smartbox from the original game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

100 neue Fragen, 1.000 neue Antworten aus dem Bereich Geschichte!

Für alle, die in Geschichte fit sind, bietet sich die Themenedition „History“ an. Einfach die 100 neuen Fragen mit dem halben Kartensatz aus der Smartbox des Originalspiels oder der Family Edition tauschen und schon steht weiteren spannenden Quizrunden nichts mehr im Weg.

Fragen wie „Welche griechische Gottheit ist zuständig für den Schlaf?“, welche Staaten waren Mitglied im Warschauer Pakt oder ob das Ende des 100-jährigen Kriegs im 15. oder 16. Jahrhundert war, lassen Geschichtsprofis ab 14 Jahren sicher teilweise ins Grübeln kommen oder zum Zocken animieren.

Pro Frage stehen zehn Antwortmöglichkeiten zur Wahl, die mit Markern abgedeckt sind. Wer an der Reihe ist, wählt eine davon aus, kontrolliert, ob’s stimmt und gibt die Smartbox an den nächsten Spieler weiter. Wer keine Antwort mehr geben will, sollte besser passen, denn wer falsch liegt, verliert alle Punkte, die er in der laufenden Runde gesammelt hat. Wer weiß die richtigen Antworten oder rät und zockt am besten?

Die Packung beinhaltet 50 beidseitig bedruckte Karten mit neuen Fragen und Antworten für noch mehr Spielvergnügen.

Nur spielbar mit der Smartbox aus dem Originalspiel!

—description from the publisher

Name: Smart10: Entertainment
Description:
100 new questions, 1,000 new answers about entertainment!

Are you looking for a change from the popular and award-winning quiz game Smart 10 and want to shine as a movie junkie? Then the 100 new questions in the theme edition "Entertainment", which can be traded with half the deck of cards from the smart box of the original game or the Family Edition, are ideal for you!

Questions are asked here about the cast of well-known TV series, but also about the 50 most visited websites. Who can sort Apple products by year of release and know or guess the characters from "Toy Story"? Quiz rounds will definitely be entertaining with the 100 new themed questions!

There are ten answer options to choose from for each question, which are covered with markers. Whoever has a turn chooses one of them, checks whether it is correct and passes the smart box on to the next player. If you don't want to give an answer anymore, it's better to pass, because if you get it wrong, you lose all the points you have collected in the current round. Who knows the right answers or guesses and gambles best?

The pack contains 50 double-sided cards with new questions and answers for even more fun.

Only playable with the Smartbox from the original game!

—description from the publisher (translated)

100 neue Fragen, 1.000 neue Antworten rund um Entertainment!

Ihr sucht etwas Abwechslung für das beliebte und mehrfach ausgezeichnete Quizspiel Smart 10 und wollt als Film-Junkies glänzen? Dann sind die 100 neuen Fragen in der Themenedition „Entertainment“, die mit dem halben Kartensatz aus der Smartbox des Originalspiels oder der Family Edition getauscht werden können, ideal für euch!

Gefragt wird hier nach den Besetzungen bekannter TV-Serien, aber auch nach den 50 am meisten besuchten Webseiten. Wer kann Apple-Produkte nach dem Erscheinungsjahr sortieren und kennt oder rät die Figuren aus „Toy Story“? Unterhaltsam werden Quizrunden mit den 100 neuen Themenfragen auf jeden Fall!

Pro Frage stehen zehn Antwortmöglichkeiten zur Wahl, die mit Markern abgedeckt sind. Wer an der Reihe ist, wählt eine davon aus, kontrolliert, ob’s stimmt und gibt die Smartbox an den nächsten Spieler weiter. Wer keine Antwort mehr geben will, sollte besser passen, denn wer falsch liegt, verliert alle Punkte, die er in der laufenden Runde gesammelt hat. Wer weiß die richtigen Antworten oder rät und zockt am besten?

Die Packung beinhaltet 50 beidseitig bedruckte Karten mit neuen Fragen und Antworten für noch mehr Spielvergnügen.

Nur spielbar mit der Smartbox aus dem Originalspiel!

—description from the publisher

Name: Piesku, szukaj domu
Description:
Educational game for children. It shows the fate of homeless dogs, both those living on the street and those that ended up in animal shelters. 
A dog running in the streets may be caught by the guards. By throwing the dice, we check if he has a chip with an address. If he has, he goes to the owner. If not, he ends up in a shelter. A homeless dog can also run into a car, and then goes to the vet for treatment. If he has a chip, it returns to the owner, if not, he goes to the shelter. The dice rolls decide about the events. Someone can come to the shelter to get the dog. A dog from a shelter can also appear on television and attract attention so that someone adopts he.
The winner is the player whose first four dogs (pawns) find a home.

The game is co-financed by the "Program for the care of homeless animals and prevention of animal homelessness in the capital city of Warsaw" prepared by the Environmental Protection Office of the Warsaw City Hall.

Name: My Best Chef
Description:
My Best Chef is a multi-action card game that earns resources by efficiently working more than 50 types of staff working in restaurants.

As the restaurant manager, your goal is to gather the resources to hire staff, get more resources by working them, hire better staff and create a highly regarded restaurant.

The staff are all unique cards.
Cards that can be adopted range from cooking staff, including chefs who cook food at restaurants, to staff who provide the necessary customer service, purchasing, and recruitment for the store, and staff who manage disposal.

The main point of this game is to collect resources in cooperation with the staff of each department.

Another point is the "disposal token".

This represents the garbage (waste) of the ingredients that are generated when the staff works at the restaurant. Care must be taken as overworking and accumulating waste will damage the restaurant's reputation, resulting in loss of ratings and dismissal of staff.

In order to solve these problems, it is necessary to hire management staff to dispose of waste and keep the store clean.

Name: The Quest Kids: Big Bads of Tolk's Cave
Description:
The Quest Kids are back in a new expansion for the acclaimed dungeon crawler for young players 5 years old and up!

The Quest Kids: Big Bads of Tolk's Cave introduces a new Quest Kid hero (Flint the Dragon), player specific dice, unique items, story-driven event cards, epic boss battles and more.

For 2-5 players ages 5 and up Big Bads of Tolk's Cave builds on the fantasy gaming foundation established by The Quest Kids by adding even more dungeon crawler essentials.

A Quest Kids quest is never done!

—description from the publisher

Name: Truth or Drink: On the Turps (Aussie Edition)
Description:
A whole carton of refreshing Aussie truth! Over 300 ripper new questions, for those with a hard-earned thirst for knowledge.

Think you know your mates? Drink again. By the end of the night, we’ll all be better friends after sharing the things we never thought we’d say out loud. Heaps of crisp, fresh questions. Aussie as.

Every turn, a judge draws a question card and selects two people to either answer or drink. Players win the round by giving a satisfying answer and being awarded the question card.

Name: Hello Kitty: The Worldwide Game
Description:
Hello Kitty  and her Friends  in an exciting and adventurous race around the world.
Take a card, move your piece and be the first to reach the Beatyfull Place. Collect fantasy cards and earn precious objects along the way.
Who will be first to end their journey?

Name: Magicon
Description:
A family card game which leads to story creation, supporting logical thinking and improving perceptual abilities.

You play saviors of the mysterious realm Magicon, which suffers the invasions of the dark forces. Your party travels to the outskirts of Magicon, but only one of you will succeed. Which one of you is the chosen one who will make the journey to the Wizardon? Who is the one who becomes the savior of the eternal light, entrusts them to the hands of the Great Mage and ignites the hope for the whole Magicon?

A strategy game for 2-6 players. The goal of each round of the game is to get rid of all the cards. You place your cards one by one so that the color markings expressing the journey through the land of Magicon. The score depends on the last card dealt. The more northern the region, the more points. It doesn't matter whether the player finished sooner or later.

The game is played on multiple rounds. Every time the game is finished, players mark their points on the scoring board with a playing figure of the chosen color. Whoever reach 10 points on the scoring boar, wins.

Name: 4 přírodovědné hry
Description:
A folder of four game plans with dice and figures. Games for young schoolchildren, which introduce children to the world of animals, evolution and European birds. When they play, there is room for creating their own stories.

The folder is laminated on 2 mm thick cardboard and has a size of 98 x 34 cm when fully unfolded. The package includes a bag with a wooden cube and 4 figures and a set of chips made of hard cardboard.

The Poaching Game is a cooperative game where a team plays against poachers who steal animals. The goal is to secure a given number of animals on all continents and free the stolen animals from poachers. Players travel the world and save an animal when they enter a field with the particular animal. However, there are also hordes of poachers on the route, over which you have to win in dice fights, otherwise the animal will go into captivity. The tension in the game can be increased by putting more animals in captivity at the beginning. The game plan with the animals is set in a real map, so non-violent learning about the continents and their animals is ensured.

The Bird Game is a contribution to refreshing our birds knowledge. Players travel in concentric circles to a nest. You overcome cats in battles and run away from a storm, hawk or ornithologist. To enter the next circle, the player must collect 4 tokens, which you get when entering the squares with birds.

In Evolution, players run freely around the game board and on evolutionary accelerators you gain and exchange different parts of the body in exchange offices. The goal is to collect the body parts for the animal you choose and bring it to its field. At the end of the game you have the honor to describe or draw a monster in which you would evolve using all the body parts you have collected.

Crazy Animals is a simple game in which children compose torn sentences about animals in Czech and English. This is how sentences like "I am a green giraffe singing in the fridge" are created.
Families: Series: 4x for preschoolers and young schoolchildren

Name: Bloodfist Champions
Description:
Battle in league 5 vs 5 Arena matches, every-man-for-himself Battle Royale matches, or tour the world with your friends since 3 games come in 1 box with Bloodfist Champions. Bloodfist Champions allows for multiple ways to play.

The original game, Bloodfist Champions, allows players to choose their fighting forces from 45 different teams, each with its own completely unique characters and style of play. Players battle through a league style setting, with each match awarding them experience points and gold for their team.

Bloodfist Champions: Battle Royale pits up to 30 players, each controlling one character, in a massive winner-take-all bout. It includes the same experience points and gold gains as the original, but focus is narrowed to what helps one player in the arena, rather than worrying about a whole team.

Bloodfist Champions: RPG is a tabletop roleplaying game in the world of Bloodfist, allowing players to experience the rich world as a group of traveling Bloodfist players, either as a team or as individual Battle Royale players (or both).

All of this mayhem runs on a system of dice involving uniquely illustrated six-sided attack dice. You roll to attack your enemy, and, if successful, roll again to see if you hurt him. Any time you hit an opponent hard enough to hurt him in any way, you earn, 1, 2, 3, or 5 experience points for the player who performed it, and the same amount of points are scored toward victory for your team (or individual in Battle Royale).

Name: Conductor: Stories from the Underground Railroad
Description:
In this solitaire roll-and-write game, you’ll become a conductor on the Underground Railroad, shepherding a party of self-emancipated fugitive slaves on a flight to freedom.

Designer's note: These rules apply to the standard form of the game. The system is designed to support scenarios representing individual slave narratives.  Each may modify these basic rules.  Played together, they offer a survey of this important literary genre, and the personal histories it sought to depict.

A game about fugitive slavery is not to be taken lightly. My intention has been to represent something of the experience of slave narratives in ludic form. I have approached my subject not as a trivial pursuit, but as an effort to explore how games may represent the most serious parts of our past.  In this spirit, I invite you to play and share your thoughts.

—description from the designer

Name: SHASN: Rome 40 BCE – Fall of the Republic
Description: This Campaign deck with Rome 40 BCD theme, change the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of ancient Rome.

Name: SHASN: Earth 2040 – The Future of Humanity
Description: This Campaign deck with the Earth 2040 theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the hypothetical politics of the near future

Name: Carnival Carnage
Description:
This is a carnival-themed set collection card game with take-that elements.

—user summary

Be the first to collect a full set of carnival cards - they could be anything from acrobats to animals, rides to sideshows. But keep your wits about you because things can take an unexpected turn at the carnival and the carnage cards are there to wreak weird and wonderful havoc!

—description from the back of the box

Name: SHASN: India 2019-20 – Ideology Cards
Description: This campaign deck, with an Indian elections of 2020 theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of the modern India.

Name: SHASN: USA 2019-20 – Ideology Cards
Description: This Campaign deck with the US elections of 2020 theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of the modern US.

Name: SHASN: UK 2019-20 – Brexit
Description: This Campaign deck with the Brexit referendum in the UK theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of the modern UK.

Name: Triads
Description:
The Oryius titans of war dropped into the atmosphere of Bengall II. Planetary orbital fire screeched in vain as the Oryius forces were dropping short of their range. Thunderous echoes reverberate as the giant mechanized robots, or “mecha”, hit the ground. Although wise to avoid dropping directly into the city, the forces of Bengal II were now alerted to their presence. Forces were moving to intercept.

Triads uses counters and traditional wargaming gameplay to simulate robotic combat of the future. Players choose a team of three triads of mechanized robots. Each member of a triad  can work independently but gain their greatest strength working as a team.

The objective is to destroy your opponents robot forces.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: SHASN: Game board for 2-3 players
Description:
A 2 player version of the original game.

SHASN is a political strategy board game where every player takes on the role of a politician in the midst of a political campaign. With each turn, players must draw an Ideology Card and take stands on divisive and urgent political issues. These choices will help them gather resources to influence voters or purchase strategic powers. Players can build diverse Ideologies with every policy decision, to best reflect their beliefs and play style. As they progress in the game, players must choose between sticking to their ideals or molding them as per their needs. In a game of trading, coercion, and strategy, players must do whatever it takes to survive and dominate.

Name: Dungeonrunner: Castle of Emperor Zinn
Description:
The riches inside Emperor Zinn's castle are as numerous as the rumors of what else lies inside. Deadly traps are to be expected...but a minotaur in a maze?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

Name: Boise is Brighter
Description: it was a vintage Monopoly clone with properties showing the businesses and buildings of Boise, Id.

Name: Dungeonrunner: Muckelf Swamp
Description:
The goblin bandits and the muckelves who dwell in the swamp are constantly fighting. Just passing through, you are caught in the middle. Neither side cares.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

Name: Omni ECG
Description:
Omni is a fast paced strategy game focusing on "Ascending" your souls (Basic Monsters) into Entities who have stronger abilities. There are a ton of unique mechanics, including:

- Ascension (with use of our "Evoval" (or evolution value) concept)
- Soul tokens (living shields)
- Crystal progression system

Lore:
Within Omni, a realm of constant flux, there stand massive Relics of unknown origin. These Monoliths, the Gate Crystals, are the source of all existence in Omni. From them, Souls manifest and engage in battle for complete omnipotence. Enhance your Souls with Quirks which provide unique abilities and allow them to ascend into Entities of considerable power. Change the tides of battle with Events that become reality through the magic of these Crystals. Be wary! When one of these great Monoliths shatters, the gate of creation closes with it. Wage war against other crystal wielders; use your mighty Gate Crystals and their adaptable creations to claim Omni for your own!

Gameplay:
Game starts with players selecting a Soul from their Existence deck (or "Monster" pool) to begin the battle, placing one crystal on their board, and drawing three cards from their Standard deck (Event and Quirk deck). During a player's turn, they can improve their Souls by equipping Quirks and eventually Ascending them into Entities; this is done by meeting the required EvoVal points for the Entity chosen (determined by Quirks' cumulative EvoVals). Players may also play "Stabilizers" or "Destabilizers" (Omni's equivalent to "Spells and Traps") that will have an immediate impact on the gameplay. There are no "Deck Outs" in Omni - simply reshuffle the Standard deck and continue play. Once all of a player's Crystals or Souls are destroyed, they have lost the game!

Name: Biergarten (Second Edition)
Description:
In Biergarten, players compete to create the most beautiful Biergartens before Oktoberfest. Each turn, players will draw one tile from the supply, the open market, or randomly from another player's hand, then play one tile to expand their Biergarten and score points. Players score points by playing tiles that have matching colors, linking up umbrellas, and walling off their Biergarten. The player with the most points by the time Oktoberfest rolls around wins!

The game includes 76 beautifully illustrated tiles for players to choose from to truly make their Biergartens unique.

This second edition of Biergarten introduces all-new art, upgraded components, and new ways to play, including a solo mode.

Prost!

Name: Escape: Rock N Roll Spy
Description:
Your next mission takes you back in time to Benny’s Diner, the most hopping malt shop in the 1950’s.  At first, this mission may look like a breeze.  There are poodle skirts, a juke box, and the fanciest cars you have ever seen.  However, this diner holds a secret, which only the wisest can uncover.  Benny, the owner and a local celebrity, has known connections to the Soviet Union and we think it just might be possible that he may be none other than a Russian spy!  You have an hour to sneak into the diner, discover the secrets, and  figure out what Benny knows before he returns.  Good luck!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Name: Escape: Murder in the Forgotten Tomb
Description: In the 1920’s the excavation of ancient tombs was all the rage, especially after Howard Carter discovered the tomb of King Tut.  There were many other teams of archaeologists in the Valley of the Kings who were not so lucky, however.  We’ve been called back to check on the whereabouts of a team of explorers who have gone missing while on the search for one of the biggest archaeological discoveries of all time.  You have heard that the tomb was cursed, for many who enter meet grisly ends soon after.  Upon entering it yourself, you begin to believe it.  The professor in charge of the search has been murdered, his body mummified in the depths of the tunnels.  You have one hour to search the passageways, discover the codes, and find the clues to determine “whodunnit” before you too become another cursed intruder in the forgotten tomb.

Name: Escape the Titanic
Description:
In our most dangerous mission yet, you will be asked to board the infamous Titanic in a daring rescue attempt.  The ship is already beginning to angle into the water, but your team has been tasked to head deep into the bowels of the ship to save an agent and to recover a cursed object which may have brought about the disaster.  Split up to explore the elegance of the first class staterooms or take your chances in the already flooded 3rd class bunks as you gather objects to complete the mission.  Remember, however…. there were not enough life boats on board and time is rushing away.  Can you escape the unsinkable ship?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.
Families: History: The Sinking of the Titanic

Name: Escape the Silver Screen
Description:
The worst fears of your boss have come true.  Someone has discovered time travelers and has made a movie about your adventures... a movie soon to be released to the world as a blockbuster.  This simply will not do...so your team has one simple mission.  Stop the movie from being released at all costs.  Sneak into the movie studio in old Hollywood and sabotage the production without being discovered.  Hurry, the filming resumes soon!  Do you have what it takes to bring production to a halt?  Lights, Camera, Action...

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Name: Escape: Outlaw
Description:
After causing a massive change to history, you need to prove your worth to your boss at the time traveling agency.  The easiest way to regain his trust is to hunt down a time traveling object lost back in the Old West and return it to the present.  The only issue is that a band of outlaws have already found the item and plan to defend it with their lives.  It is up to you as to how you proceed.  Partner with the law to hunt down the outlaws and put them to justice... or join the gang and steal the item from under their noses.  Either way, it is up to you to recover the item... even if it comes to a shootout.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

Name: Stellar Evolution
Description:
Stellar Evolution is a game of strategy set in a distant future where mankind makes its home among the stars. Choose a race and select your fleet from the varied units available to you before leading them into battle against another player. Destroy enemy forces and capture key strategic ships in order to become the ultimate victor.

The game takes place on a square grid. The game takes place over turns, meaning that one player moves all their ships and takes all their actions before announcing their turn is at an end and the next player begins their turn. The game ends if one player destroys all opposing forces or automatically after every player has had 10 turns.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeonrunner: Lair of Lawnadynn
Description:
The tunnels are a network of confusion. Lawnadynn, the seducer, is aware of your presence. Her ensnared minions await to ambush you. Can you both overcome evil and resist?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

Name: Dungeonrunner: Crypts of Rojosh
Description:
The dark legacy of Rojosh is a tale that few dare to tell. The unholy works of the jaded cleric caused entire nations to perish. Why are you going into his crypt?

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

Name: Varda
Description:
A mysterious and adventurous journey from the bottom of the dark soil to the light of crystal flagons and a wonderful and stunning evolution from some simple flower to a prestigious essence!
   The original Iranian board game, Varda, is the winner of the 1st prize of “Land of Beautiful Mind” game designing contest and an exciting strategy game which uses the process of planting flowers and producing “Golab” (The Persian Rose-Water) to make a great challenge and puts the players in the role of farmers and craftsmen who try to plant the best shrubs and flowers in the most fertile soils and upgrade their technology to produce the most aromatic “Golab”s and most precious essences…
But be careful, in the breathtaking industry of “Golab”, there is no trace of flowers’ delicacy!

In Varda, you’re farmers who should cultivate the best Damask Roses in your lands and produce the best Golab (Persian Rose-Water), Strong Golab and Essences.

You should send your workers (meeples) to 4 different areas of the board: Planting Area, Floriculture Area, Extracting Area and Technology Area. 
At the beginning, a Year card is revealed. This card determines the capacity of each area for placing meeples, based on the number of players and shows the events of the beginning of the year and the end of the year, based on the rainfall amount. 
Each game may be played in several years so be prepared for any upcoming events!

Blue meeples can only be placed in Planting and Floriculture areas and the Green ones can only be placed in Extracting and Technology Areas. Pink meeples are the most valuable meeples; You can place them in any area (even ignoring that area’s capacity) and use them to obtain Event cards so take care of them!

After all players placed their meeples on the board, you should do the actions of the different areas by removing the meeples from the board and placing them in Resting Space.

Expand your farm and obtain the needed resources (Water, Light and Fertilizer) to have the best harvest. The Lands with special powers need more resources but help your achieve the products sooner.

Cultivate Saplings and harvest your lands and produce the best Damask-Rose products. You can develop your technology and gain new facilities, paying its price!

After all actions were resolved, take the meeples from the Resting Area as you wish and depending on your strategy, in clockwise order, starting with the First Player. Your choices would affect the others’ play!

As a beginner, you can play Varda without the Event cards which give you combinatory actions and special abilities and add them to the game only when you got enough experiences!

The winner is the player who can produce the best and more precious Golab and Essences before the rivals, develop their technology more than the rivals and reach their goals.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dogfight
Description:
A real time team based competitive game where two bi-planes operated by dogs try to shoot each other out of the sky.

During alternating timed and resolution phases, players have to quickly communicate with their team-mate to play up to 4 cards between them without showing their hands, and without giving away too much of their strategy to the other team.

If you can hit the enemy plane, that team will lose cards from their decks until one player runs out completely, and that plane is shot down.

Name: Kuflikupac
Description:
Maybe you know the seven kufliks: Zödön, Bélabá, Pofánka, Valér, Tituszt, Hilda and Fityirc, who live in the kufli-heap, in the meadow. They just play and relax all the day. Play with them too! Make a kufli-heap alone, play with the kufli-memory game or the kufli-collector game. If you are a good tactician, buy the kufli-heap cards from the other players and be the first who mades his whole kufli-heap.


Ugye, te is ismered a hét kuflit, Zödönt, Bélabát, Pofánkát, Valért, Tituszt, Hildát és Fityircet, akik az elhagyatott réten laknak a kuflikupacban, és egész nap csak játszanak és heverésznek? Most játssz te is veluÌˆk! Rakd ki egyeduÌˆl a kuflikupacot, játssz a kuflimemorival és a kufligyÅ±jtögetÅ‘vel, vagy taktikázz uÌˆgyesen, és vedd meg a többiektÅ‘l a kufliuÌˆreged darabjait a leghamarabb! A kicsik kedvencei – kicsit másképp!

Name: Mein Körper: Das Quiz
Description:
Why does our hair turn gray? How many chambers does the heart consist of? What causes tooth decay? Our body is a miracle! Mein Körper - Das Quiz (= my body, the quiz amazes and amuses, and lets young and old quizmasters prove how well they know the human body. The quiz game contains everything children want to know about our organs, bones, and cells, as well as the exciting processes of human life. There are also plenty of unbelievable facts and crazy stories.

Each player draws a card from each of the different categories. The youngest player starts and turns over one of the cards from their own little pile. If it is a solo card, the question may only be answered alone. If the answer is correct, the card may be kept. If it is a chance card, all players may guess the right answer. The player who comes up with the correct answer the fastest receives the card. The goal of the game is to be the first to play out all the cards from your own pile and collect more correctly answered cards than the other players.

Name: Das Feel Good Spiel
Description:
Das Feel Good Spiel is a card-based game that is all about expressing affection and appreciation for your loved ones by answering the questions on the cards. The game helps to create a conscious moment for compliments and nice words.

The small cards support players in finding the right expressions and give ideas for different topics they want to highlight with compliments. The game is not about winning or losing, but solely about positive vibes and the players' well-being. In the course of the game, the players compliment each other and express their mutual appreciation in a creative way. On 100 cards, there are numerous ideas for kind words, encouragement and compliments.


     In each round, one person receives compliments from their fellow players.
     One person draws a card with a compliment idea and reads it aloud.
     The other players add their own personal compliment and write it on a piece of paper.
     Afterwards, all compliments are read aloud.


The game can be played with in a variation where each player has to guess who wrote down what and receives one point per correct guess. Whoever has the most points wins.

Name: Varia Starter Set
Description:
The Varia Starter Set is a card & dice dueling game where players select from one of two fantasy-themed classes. Players take turns planning out a course of action before rolling dice to see whose tactics come out on top.  By using a combination of weapons, armor, and cards in hand, players create a plan of attack (or response to an incoming attack) each turn. The goal is to knock the other player’s health points to zero through clever card combinations, while simultaneously preventing your own defeat by planning tactical defensive moves.

Gameplay is divided into two major phases. The planning phase sees players laying out their actions for the turn, which represent attacks and blocks that the players will perform. The resolution phase has players rolling combinations of dice as dictated by the cards they played in the planning phase in order to determine what attacks hit or miss, and what damage (if any) is dealt or avoided.

The starter set includes: Volcanic Warrior & Shadow Assassin.

Name: Girl Talk: Sassy Sticks
Description:
Girl Talk games are all about getting together with your friends and having fun.  Sure, there's a way to win if you want to be competitive, but there's also room for plenty of LOL moments in each game so you can just sit back, chill out and have a great time with the girls.

Who’s got the best answer? Pick a stick with a question on it and roll the dice to “fill in” the missing word. Then, think up a good answer to the question based on the kind of answer the die asks for — whether it’s silly, weird, true or anything else!

The best answer gets a ring. The person who collects the most rings, wins!

Name: ISO
Description:
In ISO you will delve into a world of isometry where you will compete against your opponets for the completion of objectives in one of the 3 different perspectives.

It is for 1-3 players and lasts about 5-10 minutes per game, and it will most definitely be testing your conception of space and perspective. Control the three dimensions and be a step ahead of your opponents intentions to achieve the victory, or enjoy a rewarding cooperative challenge together.

Players will take turns playing the topmost tile of the pile, with the purpose of claiming some of the revealed objectives and not letting the other players claim them when their turns arrive. As soon as all tiles are placed, the game will end and the player with most points will be the winner.

May your eyes don´t play tricks on you while at it :)
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Wreckland Run: Fallout
Description:
Welcome back to the Wreckland. You've made quite a name for yourself on your past runs, but there is always room for growth and new threats appear from out of the wastes every day. These new enemies are bringing new TOXIC weapons into play, sure to slow down your carnage. But you've also been outfitted with new MISSILE weapons, capable of long-range damage. New vehicles, new enemies, new bosses... time to run AGAIN!

The Fallout expansion is expanded content for Wreckland Run. It includes 1 campaign book adding 3 chapters to the campaign, 2 vehicle mats, 2 pilot cards, 6 upgrade cards, 9 parts cards, 9 enemy cards, 3 new bosses, and 9 green "toxic" gems.

Name: Yakalaï
Description:
Yakalaï is a cooperative role-playing game that takes you to fantastic lands. You must cooperate, survive and gain experience in order to complete your quest. No need for a passionate game master. The players, guided by the cards, take turns fulfilling this function.

Each turn, you turn over a card, decide to travel there, or not, follow the instructions. To resolve the events, just roll the dice. When you arrive at the end of the last card, you succeed the adventure. If you survive, that is.

Easy to access Yakalaï allows you a quick introduction to the mechanics of role-playing games. The 4 character classes and 36 event cards will create a multitude of situations for you that will challenge even the most seasoned adventurers.

Name: Dungeonrunner: Tower of Saxon
Description:
The Tower of Saxon has been left alone for ages. Some think it was taken over by dark machinations, others think it is cursed. They are both right.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

Name: Dungeonrunner: Mountains of Zokar
Description:
The inhospitable mountains are patrolled by numerous actions. Armies cannot make their way though without a fight...but perhaps a lone wolf could.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

Name: Dungeonrunner: Caverns of Grot
Description:
Grot's tunnels curve and confuse as creatures lurk and linger. Some attack out of instinct, but others seem to be aware of you. Grot's Ogre-Magi knows you are coming.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

Name: Dungeonrunner: Roads of Tonar
Description:
The Roads of Tonar connect all the cities and villages in the land. If you have a destination in mind, the Road of Tonar will take you there. Don't expect to be alone.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

Name: Dungeonrunner: Deck of Deadly Things
Description:
You angrily snatch the jester's deck. He twiddles his thumbs as you open it. Drawing the first card, you hear his taunting laugh as you are transported into the Elsewhere. You feel the chaos surround you.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

Name: Ultimate Treehouse
Description:
Ultimate Treehouse is a game of building and strategy for ages 7 and up.

Each player starts with a beautiful blank tree mat and builds a treehouse full of fun classics. The first one to have 6 elements in their treehouse wins. Player on player cards allow you to slow down your opponents, helper cards will allow you advantages and disaster cards may slow you down.

On your turn you draw cards and then can do one of three actions; build, play a card or draw again. To build you use material cards from your hand like lumber, nails and metal to build parts of the treehouse. The game ends when you have 6 elements in your treehouse- 3 required elements and any other three you choose.

Name: Bible Brawl: End Times Expansion
Description:
The End Times Expansion Pack adds 30 more cards to be used with your base game of Bible Brawl.

This expansion pack draws inspiration from stories and characters from the book of Daniel and Revelation. From a seven-headed red dragon to a minion of the Locust King Abbadon, you never know what you are going to pick up next.

Name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – Omega Forever
Description:
Omega Now, Omega Forever! When the Morphin Grid was shattered, its energy empowered individuals across the galaxy. In Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – Omega Forever, you can play as one of the powerful Omega Rangers or the dangerous Anointed.

Both sides bring new cards and mechanisms to the fight! Cavotus, for example, is the only villain that can actually flip to his empowered side without having all of his attachments slots filled (and watch out when he does!), while the Rangers can make use of their new Omega Coins to temporarily flip to their Ranger side, or can use the coin when already morphed to trigger additional effects!

—description from the publisher

Name: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Earth – Ramparts of the Empire
Description:
Okko Chronicles - Ramparts of the Empire features the legendary Rônin and his fellow travelers who, taking refuge in strongholds scattered throughout the mountains, must fend off the countless invading armies of Karasu before they breach the Pajan.
During a game, each player will choose to embody one of the Heroes. Together, they will have to make the best decisions to ensure that the fortress can withstand the repeated assaults of the undead.

Okko Chronicles - Ramparts of the Empire can be played in cooperative or semi-cooperative mode:
In semi-cooperative mode, one of the players will play as Black Tiger, an evil ninja, a former hero corrupted by necromancy, who has infiltrated the fortress to facilitate the arrival of the Karasu era!
In cooperative mode, a deck of Black Tiger Reaction cards will allow you to make this dangerous opponent act.

During a turn, each player plays one or two of their action cards; these cards give them advantages to perform the 3 actions they have.

A game ends:
- when all the Heroes are put out of action or when one of the fortress walls gives way completely, leaving the Pajan Empire to the undead,
- or when the last wave of the Karasu army breaks on the defenses of the fortress, thanks to the arrival of the Pajan army.
But beware, other parallel objectives can also influence the course of the story.

The game is part of the same range as the Okko Chroicles Water Cycle. It can be considered as its sequel but the game mechanics are different and they can't be played together.

Name: Little Drawington: Halloween
Description:
Welcome to Little Drawington, a small sleepy village on a hill in the British countryside that prides itself on their beautiful gardens and friendly community. As the days get shorter and the leaves start to change, excitement rises in the village as they get to work on their autumn gardens for the Pumpkin Growing Contest. This year, the competition is extra fierce, there are strange rumours going around of unusual behaviour. It is the night before the grand jury comes by and you are not leaving anything to chance, calling upon dark forces from beyond to grow your pumpkin the biggest and even sabotaging your neighbours gardens.

Little Drawington: Halloween is a draw and draw game, where players draw cards with shapes they then get to draw on their own garden boards.

The game consists of 3 repeating phases and a final evaluation round The phases are: The Ghastly Growing Phase, the Creepy Carving Phase, and the Demonic Decoration Phase.

When the deck of root cards has run out, the sun rises and players  add up their points. The player with the most points win. The garden boards look like little clipboards from the town council, so as players are creating their gardens they are also filling in what the garden looks like on a scoring form for the end of the game.

Name: From the Cellar: Pack 11
Description:
This issue includes 10 accompanying ETO scenarios that will take you from Dunkerque to the snow covered Russian winter, Italy or Walcheren island and the replacement countersheet for "The Green Hell of Inor", countersheet # 3.

The following scenarios are included:

FT304 - Loosening the noose: Notre Dame des Neiges, South of 
Dunkerque, France, June 3rd 1940
FT305 - Kutrik: Kutrik, Volchov, Russia, April 2nd 1942
FT306 - Stalin’s Orders: Kolsovo, Russia, 28 July 1942
FT307 - Backstabbing Paratroopers: Svidovok, Russia , 13 November 1943
FT308 - Luchs: RudnIaweresnia, Russia, 9 December 1943
FT309 - Smoke on the Water: Acquafondata, Italy, 12 January 1944
FT310 - Back to the River: Dornot bridgehead, France, 8 September 1944
FT311 - Five-Oh-Sink: Outskirts of Eindhoven, Netherlands, 18 September 1944
FT312 - Near Dishoek, Walcheren island, 2 November 1944
FT313 - Sainte Barbe on Fire: Cité Sainte-Barbe, Wittenheim, France, 2 February 1945

Name: Ghosts Love Candy Too: More Ghosts Promo
Description:
This four pack set features new ghost card options that can be used by players.

The four ghosts (Chloe, Heather, Beckett, and Graydor) each have a set of 9 cards with each of the 1-9 values, for a total of 36 cards in the promo pack.

Name: Dracula: Fangs & Pitchforks
Description:
Dracula is a social deduction game. In Dracula all players are arguing for their life, convincing Dracula not to eat them while having a hidden agenda.

Welcome to Transylvania where the local Villagers have received the unwanted pleasure of joining Dracula for dinner.

One player will be the famous Count and the rest will be Villagers trying to convince Dracula that anyone else would make a better meal. Players will take turns using Excuse cards to craft their plea’s and take cues from Act cards to support their plea. But watch out, your fellow Villagers might stab you in the back using their Excuse cards to save their own skin!

The game ends, when all players have had their round as Dracula. All players count their Victory tokens. The player with the most Victory Points is the winner.

Name: Dungeonrunner: Forest of Torment
Description:
There is a reason people do not venture into these lands. However, tales of an ancient civilization with wondrous artifact compels the boisterous and the foolhardy.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!

Name: Dungeonrunner: Ruins of Narr
Description:
The site smells of musty ancient lore. Light upon its depths reveal secrets that were meant to stay hidden away from the outside world. But why? Is there more to this than simply an ancient ruin?

Name: Love Is Blind
Description:
Score big on your next game night with Love is Blind. Inspired by the hit dating show on Netflix, you’ll secretly answer a series of questions and discover who could be your best match.

Players become couples as the proposals begin -- we provide the rings, you bring the courage! Say “Yes” in the Pods and retire to The Apartments, where newly formed power couples can strengthen their bond or run from the relationship. Earn Hearts by answering real-life questions and matching your partner’s answers. Are you a mismatch? Propose to another player whose relationship is on the ropes, and you’ll get a second chance at finding your true soulmate! The first couple to earn 9 Hearts wins and lives happily ever after... or at least until your next game night.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeonrunner: Cathedral of the Celestial
Description:
Historians have said that an ancient civilization once lived in this area. Those of religious orders would disagree, adding that these beings are not archaic, but eternal! Do mortals dare enter?

Name: Dungeonrunner: Zoltar's Sanctuary
Description:
The heretic has been diving into forces unknown. Strange happenings and disappearances have been noted in nearby villages. The only way to end it...is to end him.

Name: Kellia: The Risk of the Desert
Description:
Kellia is a cooperative strategy game for 2 to 4 players.

Players work together to survive in the Egyptian desert and build their hermitages (kellia). Every turn, they start from their kellion (singular of kellia) at the edge of the board and wander into the desert to explore, build, and gather food and water to survive the night.

The turns have two phases: day and night. Each day, players have three actions, which they can use to move to an adjacent square (and reveal it, if it is face-down), get 'attention to nature' cubes by contemplating the desert, or spend cubes to either build their kellion, improve a resource square or construct a building or resource in the desert. Furthermore, they can exchange cubes with other players they meet or end their turn prematurely by begging for food or water at the church in the center of the board. Players can buy additional three actions by spending an 'inner life' cube. Due to the limited number of actions, turns have to be as well planned in advance as is possible with the hidden information.

During the night, players gain 'inner life' cubes and have to give away food and water. The players often need to cooperate: if one player fails to end the day with at least 1 food and 1 water, the game is lost for everybody. Before the next day starts, an incidence card affects the game: either a sand storm, famine or drought destroys or disables a part of the board, which is chosen randomly by rolling a dice, or bandits, fasting, or akedia affect the players.

The game ends, if one player has no food or water during a night (lost), all players built their kellion and survive the following night (won), or the 9th, 10th, or 11th day is passed without everybody having built their kellion (lost, the number of days depends on the 'difficulty' option).

Kellia is created and illustrated by the Brothers of the Taizé Community, which is inspired by the lives of the desert fathers and mothers. It combines spirituality, mutual help, and ecology.

Name: Dungeonrunner: Caves of Dey'Lithia
Description:
Zoltar has undone something deep within the earth. A living society once trapped in stasis, now released by the mad wizard. Can what is done be undone?

Description:
